TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit StrongNameSignatureInformation extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Holds the strong name signature information for a manifest.
Gets the hash algorithm that is used to calculate the strong name signature.
Docs.value: The name of the hash algorithm that is used to calculate the strong name signature.
Docs.returns: The name of the hash algorithm that is used to calculate the strong name signature.

Docs.summary: Gets the HRESULT value of the result code.
Docs.value: The HRESULT value of the result code.
Docs.returns: The HRESULT value of the result code.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the strong name signature is valid.
Docs.value: if the strong name signature is valid; otherwise, .
Docs.returns: if the strong name signature is valid; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets the public key that is used to verify the signature.
Docs.value: The public key that is used to verify the signature.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The only case that returns `null` is when <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.StrongNameSignatureInformation.IsValid%2A> is `false`. If the signature is valid, there will always be a key.

Docs.returns: The public key that is used to verify the signature.

Docs.summary: Gets the results of verifying the strong name signature.
Docs.value: The result codes for signature verification.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property and the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.StrongNameSignatureInformation.HResult%2A> property are two ways to determine whether an error occurred during verification. This property lists well-known errors that might occur. The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.StrongNameSignatureInformation.HResult%2A> property can be checked if the error is not covered by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.SignatureVerificationResult> enumeration.

Docs.returns: The result codes for signature verification.
